reviewtext: After the wireless adapter that we were using with an ancient TiVo gave up the ghost, we switched to a hard-wired connection.  This network adapter did the trick.  It was immediately recognized by the TiVo, grabbed an IP address via DHCP and we were back up and running.  It was a bit humorous to see a 3.5" floppy disk with Windows 98 drivers included in the box, but we didn't need any of the drivers.
summary: Old piece of hardware but did the trick for an old TiVo
